POST.POST_BODY: I am really nervous I have seven weeks to go they'll induced me at 37 weeks because gestational diabetes and high blood pressure.. I really don't know what to expect

RESPONSE.RESPONSE_BODY: I was induced at 37 weeks with my first son due to dilating to a 2 early on. I was nervous, but was in the care of an amazing doctor. Try not to stress too much. The nurses and staff there should be happy to answer any questions you may have in the process.

I got induced  but I was a week past due i was scared at first but it was OK its almost like to ng into labor it slowly happens over time and the after awhile u can have the epidural if u want just relax and everything will be ok goodluck to you

And my doc says she doesn't think I have it. But she said because of being a little over weight and having a little high blood pressure. If I don't go into labor and don't have my daughter by 37 weeks without having to be induced that by my 38th week she will induce me. I'm kind of excited because I wanna meet my daughter but I'm also scared. I'm scared that because your due date is just an estimation what if that estimation is wrong and in sad ready of being 38 weeks I was actually 34 weeks. I'm gonna feel like I'm alone and I'm going to flip out. And he goes okay if nobody is @ the hospital that you would like to be in there with you. Then I will go. But if I get to push and do it natural. I'm gonna have my best friend and my husband by my side holding my hands.

I read your post. I'm also on my 2nd baby and had a previous c section. However I've read in the college of ons and gynaecology that if previous c section mothers haven't had their baby by 37wks then a repeat c section should be administered! Induction is out of the question due to the previous scarring and will prolong the labour please read the section about Vbac... There is a new guideline coming in 2015 and the concerns of midwives pushing for vbac. Hope this helps you
